alert.note: Alert for Frio; Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 2:53AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Medina and northern Frio Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 253 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Frio Town to near Natalia. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Devine, Lytle, Natalia, Moore, Biry, Yancey, Bigfoot, Frio Town and Three Oaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
